title: England have already beaten South Africa to a World Cup title - ask Maro Itoje about 2014
text:
This coming Saturday in Yokohama will not be the first time that Maro Itoje has faced South Africa with a title on the line.

Five years ago, the lock led England Under-20 against Handrè Pollard’s Junior Boks in the World Championship decider at Eden Park in Auckland.

Most iterations of South Africa’s top age-grade side make their cuddly nickname look inappropriate. For the gargantuan class of 2014, it felt ridiculous.

“I spoke to their coach at a media thing two days out from the final,” says England head coach Nick Walshe, remembering a conversation with counterpart Dawie Theron.

“He was telling me how his pack was bigger than most senior international packs at the time. I’m not sure why he...
description: This coming Saturday in Yokohama will not be the first time that Maro Itoje has faced South Africa with a title on the line.
